SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: Mrs. Lavina Sampson McQuaid
2. Your address: Geriatric Centre Regina Sask.
3. Date: April 19 - 1962
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): Sigourney Iowa Keokuk County U.S.A.
5. What was your father's name and occupation? Ezekiel Silas Sampson (Lawyer)
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): June 1912
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible: Chicago, Sigourney, Minneapolis.
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.) Married - about 40 yrs.
9. What were your reasons for coming West? My husband had a job as General Sales agent for a large coal mine at Jabez Albert and a retail Coal business in Regina (Crescent Coal Co.)
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?) Manager of the Crescent Coal Co.
11. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you came? Coal Business

   Thought we were very foolish.

   Train.

   W. J. Stewart, Scarth St., Regina, Sask.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?
   Regina, 1930 Retallack St., Regina, in 1912.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.
   None

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?
   Coal business.
